intro: Benthamidia japonica var. chinensis, commonly known as Chinese benthamidia, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
